ResourceHeader.Description: THEMIS is a 90 cm telescope built in Tenerife providing 3 observing modes: the MTR mode, the MSDP mode (see below) and the IPM mode (imagery mode archived at Arthemis) A reduction software for these data will soon be available on our (TEIDE) site. The observations cover a wide range of subjects, depending on the P.I. program. This instrument allows multi-line spectro-polarimetric observations on the THEMIS telescope (MTR mode). Available wavelengths are currently in the range [430-870] nm and the polarimeter is optimized for 6250 and 4250 Angstroms. The Multichannel Subtractive Double Pass mode (MSDP) on THEMIS is a spectro-imager mode allowing a spectral analysis of broad lines (typically H alpha, Na D1 and Na D2) for a 2-D images (9x170 arcsec2 and 25x170 arcsec2). THEMIS is the name of a private company jointly operated by French and Italian public research entities.
